description: Sigma(n)/n for n such that sigma(n) is divisible by n.
comments: The graph supports the conjecture that all numbers except 2 appear only a finite number of times. Sequences A000396, A005820, A027687, A046060 and A046061 give the n for which the abundancy sigma(n)/n is 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6, respectively. See A134639 for the number of n having abundancy greater than 2. - T. D. Noe, Nov 04 2007
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1600 (using Flammenkamp's data)
maple: with(numtheory): for i while i < 33000 doif sigma(i) mod i = 0 then print(sigma(i)/i) fi od;
author: Asher Auel (asher.auel(AT)reed.edu) Jan 19, 2000
